intro: Pennisetum polystachion subsp. atrichum, commonly known as purple muhly, is a perennial grass native to the Americas. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, fluffy panicles that turn a striking purple color in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its drought tolerance and ability to attract wildlife further enhance its ecological value.
